intro: Serpyllum lanuginosum, commonly known as the downy serpyllum, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
